title: Dinesh Nirmal - IBM Newsroom
summary: Dinesh Nirmal is the Senior Vice President of Products at IBM Software, overseeing product innovation and technology direction. He has over 25 years of experience at IBM, having held multiple leadership roles where he focused on AI, data governance, and automation. Nirmal has strengthened IBM's hybrid cloud and AI capabilities through strategic acquisitions and has been actively involved in industry events and publications. He was recognized in the 2022 Ascend A-List awards and advises organizations in the tech space.

title: Vapes â€“ a burning issue - Circular Online
summary: The article discusses the environmental issues caused by the rising popularity of e-cigarettes, specifically focusing on the challenges of recycling and waste management associated with both reusable and disposable vapes. It highlights the complexities of these products due to their varied materials, which makes them difficult to recycle and often leads to significant waste being sent to landfill. The piece also explores potential solutions, including a deposit-return system and better adherence to existing regulations, while emphasizing the need for a coordinated effort between consumers, producers, and waste management entities.

title: Siemens expands its digitalization portfolio for the Indian mach ... - Siemens press release
summary: Siemens AG's Achim Peltz highlights the potential of production data in the Indian machine tool industry to enhance operations sustainably and profitably. The company offers innovative solutions like the SINUMERIK One, which facilitates the creation of digital twins and improves engineering processes. The Siemens Xcelerator platform provides a comprehensive suite of IoT-enabled tools and applications that optimize machine workflows and enhance productivity. These innovations are showcased at IMTEX 2023 to promote digitalization in machine tool manufacturing.

title: Top 10 Use Cases of Digital Twin in the Year 2023 - Analytics Insight
summary: Digital twin technology has recently gained traction as businesses transform their operations and customer interactions. Demand for digital twins has increased, with tools becoming more user-friendly and efficient. These tools utilize formats like USD and glTF to integrate various processes. The potential for digital twins to predict the states of physical parts accurately is set to revolutionize industries in 2023.

title: EGA unveils aluminium recycling initiative amid sustainability push - The National
summary: Emirates Global Aluminium (EGA) has launched the Aluminium Recycling Coalition in the UAE, partnering with various companies to promote aluminium recycling, particularly for beverage cans. The initiative aims to enhance recycling rates to support a greener economy and contribute to the UAE's net-zero goals by 2050. EGA is also planning to build an aluminium recycling plant and has developed technology to decarbonise its operations. The coalition includes key players across the aluminium value chain, focusing on sustainability and circular economy principles.
green_innovation: TRUE, because the article discusses the Aluminium Recycling Coalition, which promotes aluminium recycling to reduce environmental impacts and support sustainability goals.
business_innovation: TRUE, as the formation of the Aluminium Recycling Coalition and the development of an aluminium recycling plant represents a new initiative that significantly differs from EGA's previous operations in the aluminium sector.
green_product: FALSE, because while aluminium itself can be considered a green product due to its recyclability, the article does not specifically define a particular green product being offered; it focuses on the recycling process instead.
green_process: TRUE, as the recycling initiative and the development of a recycling plant are methods aimed at minimizing environmental impacts and promoting sustainability through resource conservation and waste reduction.
